pros: Good communication, Within walking distance, Learning new code, Getting experience teaching others, and the work hours
cons: Sometimes, the booking for volunteering for an event was annoying. But the Teachers usually let you know if someone didn't arrive if they were warned ahead of time.

pros: Coworkers treat you as friends and family.
cons: Student enrollment is currently down

job_title: Associate Professor, Computer Information Systems in Natchitoches, LA
pros: You work with amazing people--fellow faculty, administrators, and students alike. Faculty positions can create a work/life balance that aligns with their situation.
cons: As in many workplaces, lack of communication between areas can create issues. Also, as a state-funded institution, available funding always seems to be in question. Cost of living raises are rare.

review_title: Salary charge backs when college closed
pros: Competent instructors, nice working environment.
cons: Budget cuts. I serve 2500 students at 4 campuses.

pros: Flexible hours and great staff
cons: Very slow work days at times

job_title: Senior Medical Librarian in Shreveport, LA
pros: Natchitoches campus is the best for a rural town with deep cultural ties.
cons: The salary is quoted on a yearly basis, but you must take annual leave when the university closes; This is not disclosed in the offer. Pay is 15-20% below similar academic medical schools in Louisiana. Blacklisting employees is common when they leave. Poor budgets and budget constraints: Budgets seem arbitrary. Low expectations of administrative staff, toxic environment. They reward longevity, not creativity.

pros: Great environment, helpful people, wonderful place to be. Happy to go.
cons: Low pay, little room to move up.

pros: NSU is an inclusive and supportive academic community. The administration, faculty, and staff work in concert to provide top-notch educational opportunities on a beautiful and inspiring campus. The nightlife isn't great, but the sense of community and belonging make up for it. I'd recommend NSU to anyone who wants to work and learn in a warm and friendly atmosphere.
cons: Sparse nightlife. Rural setting for those who want the city life.

review_title: Toxic work enviornment and frozen wages
pros: Excellent starter position, beautiful town with a unique culture
cons: Jealous and hostile working environment. Wages have been frozen for years and are too low to meet unusually difficult housing market in the city. Administration openly gloats about blacklisting former employees.

pros: Flexible with student schedules and other job schedules
cons: As a student-worker, there's no way to get a raise.

job_title: Certified Athletic Trainer in Natchitoches, LA
pros: Good work environment, teams are fun to work with
cons: Town is old, not a lot to do

pros: Great opportunity, great coworkers, easy and fun
cons: Minimum wage, lots of work during busy season then nothing the rest of year

pros: Flexibility, benefits, time off, great environment
cons: Low Compensation, No compensation for over time

pros: Working with students is great
cons: Not a remote job in which I can work from anywhere

job_title: Electrical Engineering Technologist in Anacoco, LA
pros: affordable, excellent teachers, hands-on experience, lots of potential out of school projects.
cons: upper faculty was not willing to listen or change. The most important thing was for the school to make a profit for the state.

job_title: Professor of Music in Natchitoches, LA
pros: Academic freedom, artistic freedom, great students
cons: Rare raises, no sabbaticals, 15 hour minimum load, no credit for activities

pros: Autonomy, small school, pretty school
cons: Not much growth opportunities, low salary, no raise

review_title: A decent place to work and study as a GA or student worker!
pros:
Excellent professors who know their stuff
Friendly coworkers
Felt appreciated and supported by department head and professors
Gained great experience and skills that will benefit me in the future
The university gives 4 freebie hours for school holidays
cons:
Only allowed to work 20 hours per week
Low salary (12,000 a year...15 ish if you work during the summer too)
Graduate Assistants are not allowed to park in faculty/staff parking

pros: Friendly people ... historic and beautiful campus and surrounding town ... significant responsibility in most roles due to smaller staff sizes.
cons: Everyone seems to be on their way out or interested in finding their way out ... "it's always been done this way" mentality in a lot of staffers you encounter ... budget shortfall provides little room for financial growth regardless of achievement ... festivals/celebrations are great when they are going on but otherwise, there is very little activities around town on an average day.

pros: Great Personable environment that works around student's Class schedules. It is a great starter position for someone who needs a job. You work closely with professors in your department, so you can learn more about your field through them.
cons: The technology available to students needs to be upgraded and software that students use needs to be more compatible with what they will use in the real job market.

pros: Not a hard job but a fun job. Very relaxed
cons: No raises. Pretty much a start up job for the kids right out of college

pros: Great hours, state insurance, retirement.  Wonderful working environment.
cons: Low pay.  In order to move to a higher paying position, you must be connected to the right person.

pros: Very laid back and teachers are permitted to work without being micromanaged. Co-workers are friendly and the students are the best.
cons: Pay is lower than the average.

review_title: Great Work at Home Professor Job!
pros: Work on your own time, gain more classes as you excel.
cons: Make sure that you can manage your own time accordingly.

pros: Student provide an energy and a passion.
cons: Lack of funds in some areas.

pros:
Academic Freedom
Great Insurance and retirement
Awesome co-workers
Great Support from Department Head
cons: Pay is low and there are no raises.

pros: Collegial and a small town environment.
cons: State-wide reductions in funding to higher education.

pros: Good benefits package and hours
cons: Good ole boy system makes it hard to get in

pros: good work, smart people - bright professors
cons: low pay but good benefits
